[[Curator]] of [[Paleontology]], [[University of California Museum of Paleontology]]
President, [[National Center for Science Education]] | salary = | networth = | height = | weight = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Kevin Padian''' (born 1951) is a Professor of Integrative Biology at the [[University of California, Berkeley]], [[Curator]] of [[Paleontology]], [[University of California Museum of Paleontology]] and President of the [[National Center for Science Education]]. Padian's area of interest is in [[vertebrate]] [[evolution]], especially the origins of [[flight]] and the evolution of [[bird]]s from [[Theropoda|theropod dinosaurs]]. He served as an expert witness for the plaintiffs in the ''[[Kitzmiller v. Dover Area School District]]'' trial, and his testimony was repeatedly cited in the court's decision.[[Wikisource:Kitzmiller v. Dover Area School District et al.|Decision, Kitzmiller v. Dover Area School District et al.]] Padian received a bachelor's degree in Natural Science and a [[Master of Arts]] degree in Teaching from [[Colgate University]], and a [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] from [[Yale University]], where he focused on the evolution of flight in [[pterosaur]]s. In addition to his work at Berkeley, Padian taught science in high school and was principal author of the ''California Science Framework K–12''.[http://www2.ncseweb.org/kvd/experts/padian.pdf Expert Report from Kevin Padian, Paleontologist] ( submitted as part of ''[[Kitzmiller v. Dover Area School District]]'') In 2003 he received [[Wonderfest|Wonderfest's]] [[Carl Sagan Prize for Science Popularization]].{{cite web |url= http://wonderfest.org/sagan-prize/sagan-prize-recipients/ |title=Sagan Prize Recipients |work=wonderfest.org |year=2011 |accessdate=September 10, 2011}} He has cowritten several papers with [[John R. Horner]] and [[Armand de Ricqlès]] based on [[histology|histological]] analysis of fossil bones from the [[University of California Museum of Paleontology|UCMP]] as well as the [[Museum of the Rockies]]. Padian has authored over 100 scientific articles.[http://www.ncseweb.org/ourstaff.asp Staff Profile], [[National Center for Science Education]] In 2007, Padian was made a [[Fellow]] of the [[American Association for the Advancement of Science]].[http://www.aaas.org/aboutaaas/fellows/new_fellows.shtml AAAS - 2007 Fellows] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.ucmp.berkeley.edu/people/padian/home.php Padian Lab] at [[University of California Museum of Paleontology]] *[http://www.ucmp.berkeley.edu/museum/profiles/padian/padian_profile.html UCMP Profile] *[http://fora.tv/2007/11/04/Kevin_Padian_Investigating_Evolution Interview on Evolution] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Padian, Kevin}} [[Category:American paleontologists]] [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Colgate University alumni]] [[Category:Yale University alumni]] [[Category:Fellows of the American Association for the Advancement of Science]] [[Category:University of California, Berkeley faculty]] {{US-academic-scientist-stub}} {{creationism-stub}}
